action: I want to accurately and securely manage employee basic information, affiliations, and employment details
reason: Because I need to streamline personnel procedures while ensuring the protection of personal information
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users to view, register, or update employee information.
The system must restrict operational privileges based on defined roles (e.g., HR, Admin, Manager).
The system shall automatically generate a globally unique Employee ID for each record.
The system must require a mandatory Name field with a maximum length of 100 characters.
The system shall validate email address formats and support restrictions to specific corporate domains.
The system must validate phone number formats and manage addresses using multiple structured fields.
The system shall prohibit future dates for the Date of Birth field.
The system must require selection of Employment Status and Department from pre-defined master data.
The system shall allow linking a Supervisor from the existing employee table.
The system must encrypt personal information at rest and enforce HTTPS (TLS 1.2+) for all data transmission.
The system shall use parameterized queries and input sanitization to prevent SQL injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
The system must reject registrations with missing mandatory fields or invalid data types.
The system shall implement optimistic locking to detect and prevent concurrent update conflicts.
The system must maintain a comprehensive change history, recording pre- and post-modification values and the modifier's User ID.
The system shall allow invalidating the status of retired employees to prevent them from logging in.
The system must support logical deletion only and record the operation in the audit log.
The system shall generate specific logs for both successful and failed registration attempts.
The system must support CSV import, applying the same validation logic per row, skipping invalid rows with error logging, and executing valid data within a transaction.
The system shall trigger alert notifications when operations violate defined Service Level Agreements (SLA).
The system must store audit logs in tamper-evident storage to prevent modification.
The system shall include employee data in regular backup schedules and log any backup failures.
The API must adhere to REST principles, support versioning, enforce rate limiting, and must not expose internal database details in responses.
